content.name: imger.txt
content.content: A small image processing library written in Go. Source code: github

content.name: fractal_erosion.txt
content.content: Procedurally generate terrain using Diamond-square algorithm. Apply hydraulic and thermal erosion simulations to the terrain. Source code: github

content.name: delaunayimage.txt
content.content: DelaunayImage is tool written in Java which lets you generate artistic bitmap and vector graphic images using Delaunay triangulation algorithm. Source code: github

content.name: artistic_video_gui.txt
content.content: The project's goal was the develop a GUI application where the user can transfer the artistic style from well known pictures painted by hungarian artists to their chosen images\videos. Source code: github

content.name: coding.txt
content.content: I'm mostly interested in JVM languages like Java, Kotlin, etc. In the past I've done C/C++ professionally using MFC and Boost libraries. I'm not a big fan of dynamically typed languages, but I can get along with Javascript and Python. In my professional job/free time I've used extensively the following languages/frameworks: QT(C++ and PyQt), Android(usage of both Java and Kotlin), Angular(AngularJS as a full-stack developer at my current job, Angular2 and upwards in some private projects), Spring(extensively used at my current job, applied in several home projects).

content.name: hobbies.txt
content.content: First and foremost I like to thinker with new technologies. In my free time I frequently find myself hacking around with bleeding-edge tools, reading books/documentations, watching conference videos and tutorials. Besides, I like to read, mainly sci-fi and thrillers. You can find my goodreads profile here: szil-gyi-ervin. I'm also a gamer.

content.name: about.txt
content.content: My name is Ervin Szilagyi. I'm a software engineer currently working for RIA Solutions Group as a full-stack developer. I have a bachelor's degree in computer science and a master's degree in software engineering, both from Sapientia Hungarian University of Transylvania. I'm interested in micro-services and computer security.
